p: Among identified compounds, α-pinene, 1,8-cineole, and camphor exhibited IC 50 values of 0.63, 0.67 mM, and >10 mM and showed to be competitively reversible inhibitors of AChE [ 39]. More recently, 1,8-cineole and camphor were investigated against AChE. IC 50 values of 2.27 and 21.43 µM, respectively, were found [ 40]. A percentage of AChE inhibition of 48.5% at 1 mM was found for β-pinene [ 41]. In another work, trans-caryophyllene revealed an AChE inhibition of 32% at the final concentration of 0.06 mM with a more selective activity against BChE (IC 50 value of 78.6 μM) [ 21].
